revised_title: Close Collisions of Fast Electrons and Their Implications on Relativity
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using an automatic expansion chamber to study close collisions of fast electrons with other electrons. They found that in most cases, momentum and energy were conserved, and the predictions of the restricted principle of relativity held true. The study also suggested that energy loss due to radiation during these collisions is rare and occurs in less than a few percent of the total number of collisions.
